channel.title: NPR Topics: Science
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: After a medical evacuation from space, NASA's Crew-11 returns to Earth a month early
item.description: Four people from NASA's Crew-11 mission splashed down off San Diego, successfully completing five months aboard the International Space Station. The trip was cut short due to a medical issue.
item.content:encoded:
Four people from NASA's Crew-11 mission splashed down off San Diego, successfully completing five months aboard the International Space Station. The trip was cut short due to a medical issue.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: Kitchen countertop workers are dying. Some lawmakers want to ban their lawsuits
item.description: Some safety experts want California to stop the cutting of quartz countertops saying it can't be done safely. Lawmakers, meanwhile, contemplate a ban on workers' lawsuits against quartz manufacturers.
item.content:encoded:
Some safety experts want California to stop the cutting of quartz countertops saying it can't be done safely. Lawmakers, meanwhile, contemplate a ban on workers' lawsuits against quartz manufacturers.

(Image credit: Brian van der Brug)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Scientists call another near-record hot year a 'warning shot' from a shifting climate
item.description: Scientists calculate that last year was one of the three hottest on record, along with 2024 and 2023. The trend indicates that warming could be speeding up, climate monitoring teams reported.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists calculate that last year was one of the three hottest on record, along with 2024 and 2023. The trend indicates that warming could be speeding up, climate monitoring teams reported.

(Image credit: Bilal Hussein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The risks of AI in schools outweigh the benefits, report says
item.description: A new report warns that AI poses a serious threat to children's cognitive development and emotional well-being.
item.content:encoded: A new report warns that AI poses a serious threat to children's cognitive development and emotional well-being.
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: NASA set to bring astronaut (and the rest of Crew-11) home early for medical reasons
item.description: In an unprecedented move, NASA is bringing an astronaut crew home early from the International Space Station because one astronaut has an undisclosed medical condition.
item.content:encoded:
In an unprecedented move, NASA is bringing an astronaut crew home early from the International Space Station because one astronaut has an undisclosed medical condition.

(Image credit: NASA)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: The long-term health impacts from the LA wildfires are just becoming clear
item.description: The fires affected millions of people in the region. It could take years to understand the health consequences, but ongoing research is helping to prepare people to weather the next fires more safely.
item.content:encoded:
The fires affected millions of people in the region. It could take years to understand the health consequences, but ongoing research is helping to prepare people to weather the next fires more safely.

(Image credit: Apu Gomes)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: With the lightest touch, scientists search da Vinci's art for DNA
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Science correspondent Richard Stone about recent developments in the search for Leonardo da Vinci's DNA.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Science correspondent Richard Stone about recent developments in the search for Leonardo da Vinci's DNA.
item.dc:creator: Gurjit Kaur

item.title: Jellyfish sleep and nap like us. Studying them could help human brains
item.description: A new study analyzed the sleep patterns of jellyfish and sea anemones and found they share some sleep traits with humans. The research could provide insight into the origins and function of sleep.
item.content:encoded: A new study analyzed the sleep patterns of jellyfish and sea anemones and found they share some sleep traits with humans. The research could provide insight into the origins and function of sleep.
item.dc:creator: Megan Lim

item.title: The EPA is changing how it considers the costs and benefits of air pollution rules
item.description: The EPA won't consider the economic costs of harms to human health, at least for now. Legal and health experts are concerned that the change could make it easier for the agency to roll back rules.
item.content:encoded:
The EPA won't consider the economic costs of harms to human health, at least for now. Legal and health experts are concerned that the change could make it easier for the agency to roll back rules.

(Image credit: J. David Ake)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: California fire victims say fighting with insurance companies has delayed rebuilding
item.description: Wildfires last January destroyed communities around Los Angeles. Homeowners say recovery has been slowed by fights with insurers to get their claims paid.
item.content:encoded:
Wildfires last January destroyed communities around Los Angeles. Homeowners say recovery has been slowed by fights with insurers to get their claims paid.

(Image credit: Josh Edelson)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley
